column4: does anyone know how to make an server with an old computer ?
install server applications
a computer is a server if it provides services to other systems
well what sort of services do you want it to offer?
you dont just have a "server" you have file servers, mail servers, domain controlling servers
i think you need to study what a server actually is then move from there
then install nubuntu as it has lots of security tools
you can use gparted in live cd
backup all important data before starting, just incase
redownload one
were can i get the live cd from?
dry damnsmalllinux
virtualbox is the command in terminal
make sure you are a member of vboxusers
why?
or vbox won't run
sudo adduser <your user name> vboxusers
you can tab complete commands and file names in linux/bsd just like names in here
also handles spaces in filenames too :D
sweet
dont forget to set the correct OS when you create the box so you get the right guest additions
disable the internal one in bios
is there a easyer way?
its a better idea as its not neded. one less complication
its not in the bois

find and exec ;)

find -name '*.mp3' -exec (do conversion on file found which will be named {} )
the command will rifle throug the folder and subfolders and do whatever you say in the exec bit to any 8.mp3 files

Im gonna get chrome
Whats the package called for chrome?
chromium-browser   I believe
apr-cache search chromium
chilli0@chilli0:~$ apt-cache search chromium
did you add the repo?
i did ,    sudo apt-key adv --recv-keys --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com 4E5E17B5
sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install chromium-browser
I did run update , got some errors ill pb them
you also need to add the repo lines to /etc/apt/sources.list
ok lets see your error
i haven't added it to my sources. Just looking for the correct thing to add now.
you'll need to click thelittel arrow on the page to get the lines you need to add to reveal
k. Thanks
its called Technical details about this PPA
if you add them to the bottom of the file, press enter ono the end of the last line
i know how to do it , its installing now . Thanks anyways =]
awesome
you will need a copy or symlink of libflashplayer.so in /usr/lib/chromium-browser/plugins
you will also need to run it with: chromium-browser --enable-plugins

http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=8564326
did you download the alternate iso?
I have not. Its the desktop one...
the upgrade doc clearly states the alternate iso is needed
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/LucidUpgrades#Upgrading Using the Alternate CD/DVD
I just said , I will just use the network upgrade.
ok cool
sudo apt-get install update-manager-core; sudo do-release-upgrade
So , with the alternt cd whats the diffrence?
well you'd use the debs on the CD instead of off the lucid repos, if you used the alternate cd you would most likely still have to web update to get the latest debs
you can use the alternate to get the next release, you can go from 9.10 to 10.04 or 8.04 to 10.04 (LTS to LTS)
